title: 820-02020 Corrosion around UC300, UP700
message:
Hello.
UP700  disassembled because I do not have (he made a short circuit on PP5V_S2)

two usb C ports take --5.04V 0.27A
PPBUS_AON --12.3V
PP3V8_AON-- 0.06V  (red to ground) --164 OHM, --0.165 diode mode  
PP5V_S2-- 0V
PP3v3_S2_UPC-- 0v
PP1v25_S2-- 0v
[I]PPDCIN_AON_CHGR_R --5.16v why ?? (no difference to which port the charger is connected to)
 PP3v3_UPC0_LDO -- 3.3v
 PP1v5_UPC0_LDO_CORE  --1.5v 
 PP3v3_UPC1_LDO --3.3v
 PP1v5_UPC1_LDO_CORE -- 1.5v

DFU mode does not start
what creates the signal  PP3V8_AON ?
what is the startup procedure? 
where can I find her?


"I need a fishing rod, not a fish"[/I]

title: 820-02020 Corrosion around UC300, UP700
message:
"[I]PPDCIN_AON_CHGR_R --5.16v why ?? (no difference to which port the charger is connected to)[/I]"
Is normal, R5220 receives voltage from both USB-C ports.

Do you get CHGR_EN_MVR and P3V8AON_PWR_EN?
Check LDO5, PVCC and ENABLE of U5700.

title: 820-02020 Corrosion around UC300, UP700
message: Compare diode mode to ground on 3V8_AON with good board.

title: 820-02020 Corrosion around UC300, UP700
message:
I look and do not believe. it went on 19 v how did you know?
I put it all together ...

title: 820-02020 Corrosion around UC300, UP700
message:
Not 100% success yet.
if connected, this flex stops at 5v after connecting the charger.
If the disconnected macbook boots up normally.
I do not have a password to enter the system.
I guess I'll format it.
what is it for? (camera ? [ATTACH type="full"]60860[/ATTACH])

title: 820-02020 Corrosion around UC300, UP700
message:
Probably ALS/Camera connector.

Check diode mode to ground at PP5V_CAM, w/ and w/o that connector.
Close the connector and check if starts removing LP610.

title: 820-02020 Corrosion around UC300, UP700
message:
connector disconnected 
PP5V_CAM   diode mode to ground  0.260

connector connected
PP5V_CAM   diode mode to ground  full short circuit 

removing LP610, connector connected starts normally

conclusion ---damaged camera?

to get to it I have to disassemble the screen?
